p: Fifth, changing our consumption patterns can also help. Our current system of simply buying what we want when we want it because we can—as a result of oversupply—is ignoring the risk. Climate shocks will dramatically reduce our ability to consume in the same way; we cannot assume that additional capacity will exist elsewhere. COVID-19 might have sharpened the focus here; there is a palpable sense of reservation about whether it is necessary or desirable to return to “normal.”
